usefulItems: springform pan (10 in.), parchment paper, rolling pin, cling wrap
title: Leek Pie

ingredients.content: 3 ½ oz unsalted butter, chilled, cut into pieces, plus extra to grease
7 oz Gouda, cut into ¾ in. pieces
8 ½ oz leeks, green part, cut into 1 in. pieces (see Tip)
5 ½ oz leeks, white part, cut into ⅛ in. rounds

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line the base of a springform pan with parchment, grease sides of pan and set aside.
Place flour, butter, cream cheese, baking powder and 1 tsp salt into mixing bowl and knead <b>3 min/<b>. Transfer dough to a floured surface and form into a ball.

Roll dough out between 2 sheets of cling wrap to a circle (approx. 14 in.) with a rolling pin. Line prepared pan with rolled dough and gently push into base and around edges up to 2 inches high. Prick base with a fork to avoid air bubbles and pre-bake for 10 minutes (400°F). Meanwhile, place cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place green leeks into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add chopped white leeks and water and cook <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Drain leeks through simmering basket, place leeks into pre-baked crust and discard water.

Place reserved grated cheese, cream, eggs, ham, pepper, ½ tsp salt and nutmeg into mixing bowl and mix <b>15 sec//speed 4<b>. Pour over the leeks,  stir through with spatula and bake for 45 minutes (350°F). Cut into pieces and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: If using only the white part of the leek you will need approximately 10 leeks. If using the white and green parts of the leek you'll need approximately 3 leeks.
